dcterms:creator: N. Stolt Ansó
A. O. Wiehe
M. M. Drugan
M. A. Wiering
dcterms:description: Agar.io is an online game where the player controls a cell that must eat pellets to grow. The task involves a simplified version where the player only has a single cell and the goal is to absorb food pellets. The reward function is based on the change in mass of the cell.
dcterms:title: Agar.io

dcterms:creator: G. Brockman
V. Cheung
L. Pettersson
J. Schneider
J. Schulman
J. Tang
W. Zaremba
dcterms:description: HalfCheetah-v2 is a robotics task provided by OpenAI's gym toolkit, where a two-dimensional cheetah learns to walk using seven actuators. The state representation includes the position and velocity of the cheetah, as well as the torque on the actuators.
dcterms:title: HalfCheetah-v2

dcterms:creator: N. Stolt Ansó
A. O. Wiehe
M. M. Drugan
M. A. Wiering
dcterms:description: Agar.io (pixel input) is a variation of the Agar.io game where the agent learns from a 42 by 42 grayscale pixel representation of the environment. A convolutional neural network is used to process the pixel input.
dcterms:title: Agar.io (pixel input)
